alert.note: Alert for Grant (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 6:52PM MDT until August 22 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Along the Mimbres River from San Lorenzo down to HWY 180. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the Mimbres River, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 652 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported flooding in the warned area. - All low water crossings are running, and the Mimbres River is around 1 to 2 feet out of the banks. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Faywood, San Lorenzo, Sherman and San Juan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. In hilly terrain there are numerous of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
